WYSIWYM.ontology
Class Folksonomy

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.ontology.Folksonomy

public class Folksonomy
extends Object

Folksonomy stores the values the user specifies for properties, together with the user, timestamp and resource ID in the tag database. In the previous version, the values were stored in separate text files for each property. These methods are still available, but deprecated. This information is then used to create a tag cloud with 7 frequency groups (corresponding to 7 html-tags for font size).

Version:
1.0 20-03-2007, 1.4 09-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

getTagCloud

public TagCloud getTagCloud(OntologyReader reader,
                            OntProperty property)
                     throws FolksonomyException
Returns a TagCloud with the 100 most frequent tags in the folksonomy belonging to the given property. The tags are divided into 7 groups according to frequency. If the property has a number datatype, the tag cloud consists of ranges of values.

Parameters:
reader - Ontology
property - OntProperty
Returns:
TagCloud
Throws:
FolksonomyException - if the database could not be accessed

getTagCloud

public TagCloud getTagCloud(OntologyReader reader,
                            List<OntProperty> properties)
                     throws FolksonomyException
Returns a tag cloud with tags used for any of the properties in the given list.

Parameters:
reader - Ontology
properties - List
Returns:
TagCloud
Throws:
FolksonomyException - if the database could not be accessed

getPropertyTagCloud

public Map<String,Integer> getPropertyTagCloud()
Deprecated. Uses old text file approach

Returns a tag cloud of property names, based on how often these properties have been instantiated.

Returns:
HashMap with property names and frequencies
